nodes.text: Markets for risk-free instruments may also be segmented. Important macroeconomic reasons for segmented capital markets include capital controls and foreign exchange controls that create barriers to international capital flows and thus segment national markets. Many countries regulate or limit capital inflows or outflows, and many do not allow their currencies to be freely converted into dollars, thereby creating capital market segmentation. Similarly, some countries restrict who can hold financial securities.

Political, legal, social, and cultural characteristics that differ across countries may require compensation in the form of a country risk premium. For example, the rate of interest paid on government bonds or other securities in a country with a tradition of weak enforcement of property rights is not likely to truly be a risk-free rate. Instead, interest rates in the country will reflect a risk premium for the possibility of default, so relations such as covered interest rate parity will likely not hold exactly.

reported a spot ruble–dollar exchange rate of R23.5937/$ and a one-year forward exchange rate of R24.2316/$. At the time, the yield on short-term Russian government bonds was about 5.7%, while the comparable one-year yield on U.S. Treasury securities was 2.1%. Using the covered interest parity relationship, calculate the implied one-year forward rate. Compare this rate to the actual forward rate at the time, and explain why the two rates differ.
Using the covered interest parity formula, the implied forward rate is:

data.mathML: <math display="block"><mrow><mtext>Forward Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>Spot Rate</mtext><mo>×</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mo>$</mo></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>R</mtext><mn>23.5937</mn><mo>/</mo><mo>$</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.057</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1.021</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mtext>R</mtext><mn>24.4256</mn><mo>/</mo><mo>$</mo></mrow></math>
data.alt: Forward Rate equals Spot Rate times StartFraction left parenthesis 1 plus r Subscript upper R Baseline right parenthesis Over left parenthesis 1 plus r Subscript dollar sign Baseline right parenthesis EndFraction equals left parenthesis upper R 23.5937 slash dollar sign right parenthesis StartFraction 1.057 Over 1.021 EndFraction equals upper R 24.4256 slash dollar sign

nodes.text: The implied forward rate is higher than the current spot rate because Russian government bonds have higher yields than U.S. government bonds. The actual forward rate, however, is lower than the implied forward rate. The difference between the implied forward rate and the actual forward rate likely reflects the default risk in Russian government bonds (the Russian government defaulted on its debt as recently as 1998). A holder of 100,000 rubles seeking a true risk-free investment could convert the rubles to dollars, invest in U.S. Treasuries, and convert the proceeds back to rubles at a rate locked in with a forward contract. By doing so, the investor would earn:

data.mathML: <math display="block"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mtext>R</mtext><mn>100,000</mn></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext><mn>23.5937</mn><mo>/</mo><mo>$</mo><mtext> today</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>×</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mo>$</mo><mn>1.021</mn><mtext> in </mtext><mn>1</mn><mtext> yr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>$</mo><mtext> today</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>×</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>R</mtext><mn>24.2316</mn><mo>/</mo><mo>$</mo><mtext> in </mtext><mn>1</mn><mtext> yr</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mtext>R</mtext><mn>104,860</mn><mtext> in </mtext><mn>1</mn><mtext> yr</mtext></mrow></math>
data.alt: StartFraction upper R 100,000 Over upper R 23.5937 slash dollar sign today EndFraction times StartFraction dollar sign 1.021 in 1 yr Over dollar sign today EndFraction times left parenthesis upper R 24.2316 slash dollar sign in 1 yr right parenthesis equals upper R 104,860 in 1 yr

nodes.text: The effective ruble risk-free rate would be 4.860%.
The higher rate of 5.7% on Russian bonds reflects a credit spread of

data.alt: 5.7 percent sign negative 4.860 percent sign equals 0.840 percent sign
